name: De Vere Dunston Hall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and myself go here all the time to the restaurant for family meals so you could almost call us regulars! I have also been to a wedding here which was beautiful and the staff were very helpful and made it a lovely day. The restaurant has recently had a revamp and is now quite modern, which is all very nice but doesnt suit the old character of the hotel. If there is a large party of you they tend to give you a table smaller than you'll need and you end up banging elbows with ur neighbour, but if its just a few of you its very nice. We only live 15 miles away or so but we have been to stay here once for a weekend really just to use the leisure suite, it has a fantastic fully equipt gym, swimming pool (inside only) which has a jacuzzi corner, sun beds (at extra cost), sauna and steam room. We had fun, although its pretty pricey to stay there. You can use the facilities the all untill 8pm even on the day of checkout. The rooms are beautiful the bathroom we had was gorgeous, 2 sinks, power shower, AND bath. Dressing gowns in the rooms. We stayed on the top floor so had the odd shaped roof from the ceiling which was great but had to be careful after a few drinks not to bang our heads in some places! Room service is pretty snappy, there is a charge but you have a lot of choice. The bar area is laid back and there are some comfy sofas or chairs and tables. if you want to know anything else feel free to message me!
reviews.title: Use it regularly

likes.disliked: — The new design of the restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found a special offer on travelzoo which included 2 nights B&B in a deluxe room with unlimited golf. On arrival we were greeted by pleasant receptionist who was pleased to advise us we had been upgraded to a 4 poster-room! We had a large, comfortable room at the front of the main building overlooking the fountain and grounds.As well as a 4 poster bed we had a lounge area with sofa and chairs, large bathroom with twin sinks and bath with shower over it. There was also a tv, fridge, trouser press, iron, ironing board, hairdryer, tea and coffee tray , biscuits and bathrobes.
reviews.title: great leisure break

reviews.text: We used the leisure club a number of times during our stay - it was very clean and had a lovely pool, steam room, sauna, spa, sunbeds and gym. Towels were provided and lockers were available for a £1 deposit. Ample shower facilities and hairdryers in the ladies changing room.
reviews.title: Like a badly run Travelodge
Good weekend break location
reviews.text: The 18 hole golf course was using temporary greens which made the course slightly easier than it would have normally been. The "Bunkers" bar had a good bar menu with large portions, but the drinks were fairly pricey. The golf course is fairly busy so it's best to book tee times before you get there.
The breakfast was a buffet of juice, yogurt, fruit and cereal then a good selection of hot food which was well cooked, hot and fresh. Tea/coffee and toast were brought to the table.
reviews.title: We liked Dunstan Hall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful looking hotel, in fantastic grounds. Met with a cocktail as we checked in which was a lovely touch. Staff on Reception really friendly. Room was pleasant and we had a small patio area so were able to take advantage of the afternoon sun. Leisure area really nice, loved the fairy lights in the steam room. We were booked in on a DBB rate, so had dinner in The Brasserie. The DBB rate allows you a 3 course carvery or you can put the £18 towards the 'normal' sit down menu - we received an email explaining all this along with a price list for both the food menu and the beauty treatment menu. Restaurant was very busy with a hen party going on, which sort of dampened our romantic meal for 2. The food was very good, with a good choice for all 3 courses, then coffee and mints to follow, excellent value. We were warned the wine was very expensive, but we had a lovely bottle of Shiraz for £18. The only down side to the stay was the disturbed nights sleep. The bed was really comfortable, as were the pillows, but all through the night, the noise from the corridor was a real pain, it seemed as soon as I had got to sleep I was woken by noisy guests, talking loudly!!! walking past our room, this happened right up until 3am. Breakfast is only served till 10am, which I thought rather early for a Sunday, and it was very busy. I was disappointed in that there was very limited fresh fruit available, just a few very thin slices of melon, but apart from that it was pleasant enough. All in all a very pleasurable experience, and there was no noise the following evening, so I guess that means avoid a Saturday night!
reviews.title: Lovely weekend break

likes.liked: — fairy lights in the steam room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK - So this is the first review of a UK hotel I've made - What a great location - so near to Norwich city centre, yet right in the country - What a beautiful setting - you can see why so many choose this as an ideal location for a wedding ceremony!
reviews.title: So near - yet so far!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What makes this hotel so good (a four star) is not only the beautiful building (18th century Elizabethan!) but the staff. Unusually for a UK hotel, the staff are so attentive and very welcoming. Spent the Easter weekend here and OK the weather was awful, but the room and the hotel were exceptional
reviews.title: Nice hotel - if you're into golf!
